Twitter

3.2.0
New in AM 3.3.x.
Before you begin, sign up for a Twitter Developer account.

Steps

To connect your application to Twitter, you will:

  • Register a new application in Twitter

  • Create a Twitter identity provider in AM

  • Set up the connection in Twitter

  • Test the connection

Register a new application in Twitter

+Add App from Twitter Developer Portal.

  1. Give your application a name.

  2. Click Complete.

Twitter will generate an API Key and API Secret Key for your application; make a note of these for later use.

Create a Twitter identity provider

You create an identity provider for each security domain.

To create an identity provider:

  1. Go to http://GRAVITEEIO-AM-UI-HOST.

  2. Click Settings > Providers.

  3. Click the + button.

  4. Select Twitter as your identity provider type and click NEXT.

Ensure you have the API Key and API Secret generated by Twitter to hand.

  1. Give your identity provider a name.

  2. Enter your Twitter API Key and API Secret Key.

  3. Click Create.

Copy the URL in 1. Configure the Redirect URI to the right of the page. You need this value to update your Twitter application settings in the next section.

Set up the connection

Go to your Twitter application settings and edit the Authentication Settings.

  1. Enable 3-legged OAuth.

  2. Add a Callback URLs with the Redirect URI created in the previous step.

  3. Click Save Changes.

Test the connection

You can test your Twitter connection using the web applications you created in AM.

In AM Portal, click Application > Identity Providers and select your social identity provider.

To test the connection, call the Login page (the /oauth/authorize endpoint). If your connection is successful, you will see a Sign in with button.

If you do not see the button, there may be a problem with the identity provider settings. Check the AM Gateway log for more information.
